SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am24.model.card

Class CardCorner

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am24.model.card.CardCorner
public class CardCorner extends Object
The CardCorner class represents a corner of a card, which can hold a symbol and be hidden or covered.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CardCorner(Symbol symbol, boolean hidden)
    Constructs a CardCorner with the specified symbol and hidden state.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    coverCorner()
    Covers the corner, setting its covered state to true.
    char
    getCornerText()
    Gets the text representation of the corner for display purposes.
    Symbol
    getSymbol()
    Gets the symbol assigned to this card corner.
    boolean
    isCovered()
    Checks if the corner is covered.
    boolean
    isHidden()
    Checks if the corner is hidden.
    void
    setEmpty()
    Sets the corner to be empty by removing its symbol, and setting its hidden and covered states to false.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CardCorner

      public CardCorner(Symbol symbol, boolean hidden)
      Constructs a CardCorner with the specified symbol and hidden state.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol to be assigned to the card corner
      hidden - the hidden state of the card corner

  • Method Details

    • getSymbol

      public Symbol getSymbol()
      Gets the symbol assigned to this card corner.
      Returns:
      the Symbol of this card corner

    • coverCorner

      public void coverCorner()
      Covers the corner, setting its covered state to true.

    • isHidden

      public boolean isHidden()
      Checks if the corner is hidden.
      Returns:
      true if the corner is hidden, false otherwise

    • isCovered

      public boolean isCovered()
      Checks if the corner is covered.
      Returns:
      true if the corner is covered, false otherwise

    • setEmpty

      public void setEmpty()
      Sets the corner to be empty by removing its symbol, and setting its hidden and covered states to false.

    • getCornerText

      public char getCornerText()
      Gets the text representation of the corner for display purposes.
      Returns:
      a char representing the state of the corner: ' ' if covered, 'K' if the symbol is INK and not hidden, the first character of the symbol's string if not hidden, 'E' if empty and not hidden, 'H' if hidden, '-' otherwise
